snippet: François Hollande, who was the mayor of Tulle, France, for seven years, has won praise there for his common touch.
abstract: Francios Hollande completed his campaign for the French presidency in Tulle, France; Hollande, who served as mayor of Tulle for seven years, praised the city as a symbol of resistance during the World War II Nazi occupation.
lead_paragraph: François Hollande, who was the mayor of Tulle, France, for seven years, has won praise there for his common touch.

headline.seo: France’s President-Elect Hollande Has Fans at Home
headline.main: France’s President-Elect Has Fans Aplenty at Home
headline.print_headline: France’s President-Elect Has Fans Aplenty at Home
